So thanks to Dr abaka for bringing back my wife,and brought great joy to my family once again Thanks...
author: Nath S.

description: Definitely worth the wait! We visited from out of state and was recommended to try them out. The line was long tho. Ladies at the counter were very nice. Cheesetart gets a five from me !
author: Xee V.

description:
Came in just in time before they sold out for the day on grand opening. I ALWAYS bear in mind to have less or no expectations with service on the first day, since there's always room to work out kinks later on. My SO and I waited about 30 minutes while talking to the marketing guy holding a "sold out" sign at the back of the line. I can tell service was trying their best after working such a hectic day. 

Anyways, to the most important part -- the tart, "goddamn" was my first thought. Not gonna lie, I had some kinda Shokugeki foodgasm a little bit not to sound like a hypey foodie. The cheese was light like Zanze's cheesecake (also recommend!), and the tart had a great kinda cookie biscuit like texture that balanced it out. Like many Japanese treats, its not overly sweet but just a good amount. 

Been missing Japan since I visited a couple weeks ago, so this was a nice pick me up.
author: Olivia C.

description: Came here on Tuesday afternoon, the line was still very long. It's located in front of the bart entrance, right next to Cako. Been seeing everyone rave about this place. So I decided to get 6 (3 original & 3 chocolate) and it was 23$ with tax included. They do accept card here. The packaging was nice considering it's a sturdy box. When I came home I immediately opened the box and tried one. I honestly don't think it's worth the wait plus the cheese tart didn't impress me. I wouldn't be returning considering it's 3.50 for one. I would just get myself an egg tart instead.
author: Tina C.

description:
Wow, the cheese tart was really good!! I guess the hype was pretty worth it. But the price is just a little pricey just for one. I waited in line for about 25 mins on a Thursdays around 6:30pm. I got 4 total and went home and warmed it up in the mini oven. Came out warm and so fluffy. Really good!!

The customer service was not good at all. The guy with glasses made it really complicated when I ordered for 4. Like he was going to give it to me in napkins and not a box... like I even asked to put them in a box to go and he looked at me confused and was like "a box?" Yes a box -__- That lost a star for sure.

But will be back again to try the chocolate one before they stop serving them!
author: Ritney N.

description:
i have super excited to try this out. but it was decent. it reminds me of the egg tarts. They are on the pricey side for its size. 

i went to try it out after work and the line was ok, but will not go back unfortunately. 

It like of looks like a big marshmellow with something yellow on top. I would say i prefer the classic egg tarts with and the crust of the egg a little torched. mmmmmmm good!!!
author: Bonnie C.

description: These cheese tarts were amazing!!! I'm praying that they open up shop in Southern California soon.
author: Kailani B.

description: This was really good.  I heard that it tasted good in different ways, cold and hot.  So I decided to try it both ways.  First I chilled it, but it didn't really taste good cold.  When I warmed it up in the toaster oven, it tasted really good.  The crust had a good crispiness to it.  Also, the cheese tart just melted in your mouth.  I love hokkaido cheese and this was awesome as tart.  Can't wait to try more from there.
author: Arianna C.

description: Waited 30 mins in line on a Saturday afternoon. By that time, they had already sold out of the chocolate flavor. The cashier said they fly in the tarts frozen directly from Hokkaido, Japan. Well, shouldn't they ship more chocolate if it sells out quickly? The baked goods just sit on the rack to be sold, but it's fresh and surprisingly still moderately hot once you get it. The original flavor and tart itself is good and you can definitely taste the Hokkaido milk flavor. The con is if you buy individual tarts, they put it in a paper bag instead of a box so the cheese oozes off the tart if you don't keep the bag straight. It can also be a bit messy to eat, because the cheese is melted. You can put it in the fridge so it will become cheesecake or you can put it in the freezer and it will become an "ice cake". I'm not sure what an ice cake is. I tried refrigerating one of the tarts and it did turn into cheesecake form, but it isn't the soft and fluffy type, it is more like an american cheesecake where the texture is dense. You will definitely be thirsty after eating one, so have your beverage of choice ready. The cashier said it goes well with coffee so that is why they sell coffee.
author: Donna M.

description: Had the strawberry in Tokyo 3 weeks ago, and had the classic in SF yesterday. It's got the same fluffy taste and perfect crust! I think I actually prefer the classic, but the strawberry is delicious as well. Excited for when the SF location has strawberry later this summer! There was no line since we went around 1030am on a Saturday, so if you just want to try it I highly recommend just coming in the morning.
author: Elisa L.

description: Came here on Saturday around 5pm, and waited about 15 minutes in line. We got both the Matcha and cheese tarts. The cheese tarts were like warm fluffy cheesecake with a crispy crust. The matcha was similar, but with a very pronounced matcha taste. I would definitely come back the next time I come to the mall.
author: Brandon T.

description:
gave into the hype and decided to check this place out with a few coworkers.
 
waited about 45 minutes and the line was going out into the bart station so that wasnt too fun. honestly the tarts look hella visually appealing. as long as the cheese tarts tasted good i wouldnt have minded the crap lines but i was quite disappointed in the taste. it honestly tasted a lot like an elevated ritz crackers and cheese whiz combined. i think a lot of people were expecting more of a classic egg tart kinda taste and were greeted with a bit more cheese than they wouldve like. I dont think i wouldve minded it as much (because i love cheese) but man, $3.50 for one of those? that price was a bit too steep. i guess you could say it was NACHO type of cheese youd want for that price. overall i'd say it was aight. biggest turnoffs were the line and the price along with the failed hype tied with it.
author: Patrick C.

description: What's not to love if you love cheesecake? A bit fluffier than a cheesecake but mmmm mmmm mmm so good
author: Sophia C.

description: The first time I had Bake was in Tokyo and I instantly fell in love. I'm so happy they came to SF. I had the tarts again this week and they were just as good as I remember. Line is long, but if you like sweet cheese desserts, it's worth the wait.
author: Moniza M.

description: Cheese tarts are delicious but the lines are painfully long - especially for what it is. There's definitely room for improvement in the ordering and stuffing of the boxes etc.
author: Judy K.

description: Casually found this shop over the weekend during our short visit to San Francisco. I wasn't sure what it was at first until I got closer. The smell coming off the bakery was soooo good. The line up wasn't that long so I was able to see them up close. Because we still had a lot of walking around to do, I settled in purchasing one tart. It took me about another 4 hours before I managed to eat it when I got to our Hotel. After one bite, I fully regret not buying more. The cheese tart was DA BOMB! It had the right amount of sweetness, crunch and it basically melts in your mouth. Next time, I will for sure take home more.
author: Monica P.

description: I went at noon on a Saturday and there was no line (although last time, I went in the evening and they were sold out for the day). The cheese tarts are very creamy and the crust is delicious. I think some people end up disappointed because they expect a stronger cheese flavour but I liked it this way. It wasn't overpowering and heavy, but creamy and light. I haven't tried them in Asia but I can imagine they'd be much creamier, as the ones in the US were made in japan and just shipped over frozen and reheated :/ They're $3.50 each which is a little pricey for a small tart but I'd get them again! // IG: @london_eatss
author: Cathy C.

description: The cheese tarts were yummy. I got them when they were warm and gooey and it tasted really good. I didn't think they were as good as people said they were and definitely don't think it's worth to buy half a dozen or a whole dozen. Every once in awhile is okay.
author: Sophia L.

description: Someone at work was talking about this place. I love desserts that tastes like cheesecake so it was a no-brainer for me to try. There is a line even on a Sunday afternoon but it didn't feel like I was waiting for more than 15 minutes. Ordered one and threw some cocoa powder on it. I was worried it would have a hello, custard consistency but was the complete opposite. It just melted in my mouth. Nothing jelly or custard like. Crust was just right not too crispy. I never had this at their other locations so I can't compare it that way but I'll definitely be back to try out the chocolate and the soon to come out flavor, strawberry cheesecake.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
I read a lot of reviews on here about this place before I drove an hour to try it. There's a lot of mixed reviews saying it's bland, cold, taste like cream cheese frosting, and others saying it's delicious! 
Now for my personal opinion.... I loved it! I only bought 1 because all of the negative reviews and they're 3.something a pop. There is definitely a line with this place, I think I waited 10 minutes or so. Very much worth the drive and the wait in line. As for many complaining about how they're served cold..... it's still a form of cheesecake, so I don't know why there's such a shock factor that they're served this way. A great sweet snack that's neither too sweet or too bland. I will definitely be stopping by this place again.
author: Mandie S.

description: fluffy and not too sweet. the original is my favorite and it reminds me of the asian cheesecakes but it a bitesized tart form. the line isn't too bad on a weekday. their strawberry flavor is available now and reminds me of strawberry yogurt. I love how you can eat them warm, room temp or frozen.
author: Heejin L.

description:
I predict the initial excitement will die down, pretty quickly. 

Of course, I had to try one...because word is out. Stood in line, mid-day for about 5 mins. The tart was essentially a baked gooey cheesecake in a cookie crust. Mass produced, and final baked just before sale. Tasty, yes. But there are way more authentic treats to be had around San Francisco. Bake Cheese Tart is more of a phenomenon than an actual high-quality treat. Try one, so you can say you have.
author: Alison M.

description: We are not a dessert person! But this sweeties are so addicting. The gooey whatever it is in the middle of the tart just assault my mouth. So creamy and yummy. At $3.50 per piece, it is expensive. But, now I can say I tried it
author: Merry K.

description:
Closer to 3.5 due to the price & inefficient workflow resulting in ridiculously long waits. There are only two flavors to choose from but the customers in front of us still got confused thinking that they have coffee flavored tarts (the sign reads "Brazilian organic coffee"). It took us probably 60-90min of waiting just to be able to place our order. The cheese tart itself is well balanced- creamy, slightly tart, and comforting. It's pretty darn good but again not exquisite. I would recommend taking a drive to 85 degrees in Daly City and getting yourself an egg tart instead.

Honestly they should build automatic kiosks for taking orders. As for the customers, please be ready to tell the staff so you're not holding up the line: "i want x amount of original and y amount of chocolate, please." Please try to make your numbers be multiples of 6, as each box can only carry 6.
author: Camie K.

description: 4.5 stars. These are bomb if you eat 'em fresh off the press. Just pop them in your mouth on the spot. It still taste good when you bring them home tho. Strawberry is my favorite but it's seasonal so it's gone already. Matcha is good but also seasonal too so it'll be gone Aug 31st.
author: Debra N.

description: My bf went here during his lunch break to get some for me. There wasn't much of a line on a Wednesday during lunch time. Sadly, they didn't have any of the chocolate ones. He got 6 cheese tarts for $21. It came in a cute little yellow box! From reading the reviews, I was expecting it to taste like an Asian cheesecake and not like a Chinese egg tart. I really liked it! The crust was crispy and the cheese was light and fluffy. Not too sweet, which I prefer. I would definitely get some whenever I'm in the area!
author: Kim N.

description: Absolutely amazing!!! Always a line but worth the wait and worth the price. It is a little expensive for how small the tarts are but honestly just get them!! You won't be disappointed!! Can't wait to have them again.
author: Rebecca E.

description: $21 for 6 cheese tarts is really pricey in my opinion. The cheese tart was great but I don't think it's worth paying $3.5 for a frozen cheese tart from Japan. The cheese was oozing out of the tart and the crust was crispy. The tart was great but I'd rather go to a local asian bakery and pay $1 for a regular egg or cheese tart.
author: Iris H.

description: The line was a little long but it goes by fairly quickly so I wouldn't let that scare you away! The cheese tart was the perfect combination of flavours with a hint of sweetness, savoury, and tang. The hard shell complemented the creamy, but light filling. The tart was perfectly toasted to melt in your mouth. I'm not sure if this is something I would come back for again (just because of the steep price), but it really was a great buy and I would definitely recommend trying it at least once.
author: Charmaine L.

description: I was one of those overly hyped person to try this cheese tart place, only to be slightly disappointed by it. I was expecting some amazing good cheese tarts, reality is, it's kinda just average. This place is over hyped and for $3.50/tart I think I'm going to spend my dessert money elsewhere. In addition, that line out the door??? NOT worth the time. I'm glad I tried it, but I will not be returning.
author: Jie L.

description:
Sent the hubby here since he was already in downtown. He waited in line for 45 mins. Tried it room temperature was good, tried it refrigerated and I thought was way better. I wished I froze some to see if it really tasted like ice cream. Although it was good, I think it was pretty expensive for $21 for 6.

Overall I don't think I would crave for it if I wasn't in the area.
author: Pamela T.

description:
Had to see what all the hype was about.  Line wasn't long first thing when they opened but the wait time was really deceiving. It took me 1 hour with maybe 20 people in front of me. They only had 1 person cashiering & 1 person boxing...so it was super slow! 

The chocolate flavor was my fav but I love chocolate & don't really like cheesecake very much. The regular one was like a warm, creamy cheesecake.  I think if you refrigerate them, they have a normal cheesecake type consistency. The crust was really nice too...like a crunchy cookie pie crust.

Overall, they were definitely good but not sure I'd wait an hour again for them & they were pretty expensive (6/$21).
author: Kimberly E.

description: It's very good tart. Is it worth $3.80? Maybe. Probably not worth the long wait tho. If I'm craving for cheesecake type of dessert, I don't mind standing in line for 5min for this.
author: Yik W.

description: I've been here a few times and still can't decide if the treat is worth the price but after trying the green tea tart today, which was so strong (maybe in response to another review earlier that said they could barely taste the tea) I wont be back.  I asked the staff if I could exchange the bad tasting green tea one for a regular (after a tiny bite) and they rudely said "no".  Gone are the days of customer service.  One tart to them is nothing but having to throw a disgusting expensive tart away was a treat I don't wish to repeat.  It was nice knowing you Bake!
author: Sam W.

description:
I found these to be delicious! Perfectly creamy and not too sweet. I waited 2.5 hours in line on the second grand opening day and tried the original and the chocolate cheese tarts. To my surprise, I liked the original better. The chocolate one was almost like a rich chocolate cake batter in the middle. But it couldn't compare to the delicious creamy flavor of the original. It tasted more like creamy milk rather than cheese in my opinion.
I think this place is worth taking a visit to if you are in the area or if you love sweets like me! I'm hoping to come back after the lines have died down.
 As a side note, this place is grab and go style. I don't understand the high expectations for service that some of these reviewers have. They were pleasant and efficient. The menu is straightforward and requires little explanation. The most important aspect is the food, which I think is on point.
author: Summer B.

description: I need this recipe! The tart shell is perfection and the silky cream cheese filling is silky and delicious. Can't wait to try the matcha flavor. I have yet to try this tart cold, if only I can wait king enough to let them cook down. haha
author: Janelle M.

description: Well. Can't wait before it opens(it comes all the way from Japan?!) When it's actually opened, there are hella lot of people!! All the way to the homeless in Bart!!!okey, I waited for like 35minutes to get a dozen to try (excuse me, I've been waiting for 35mins already, should buy at least a dozen, right?!) when it's almost my turn, my expectation is this high!!(hands above head, this high) when I actually try the first bite, hmmmmmmm, well...yea, it's good but not worth 35mins wait good, I will say they are 5 mins good wait. It's cheese tart, so it's creamy than the original Chinese egg tart, you almost can't feel the solid egg inside, only creamy feeling. The outside of custard is kinda like biscuit not like egg tart that super crispy tho. So..well...this is the trends in SF now, I'm millennium, I tried.
author: Yuliana Z.

description: It is good... But not worth the long line wait. Recommend for people who never tried before. Definetly get the chocolate one if you can.
author: Weiyu H.

description: I love their cheese tarts! So good yet so expensive but it's worth it. I gave it a 4 stars only because they packed it so sloppy the second time. All the cheese tarts were upside down and the creams got stuck to the box (see the pic). Looks gross but still edible. It was the guy who packaged it. Sloppy job!
author: Sharon W.

description: A taste of Japan in SF! Finally had the chance to try @bakecheesetart_usa in SF on Mother's Day! There was a line and the wait was about 30 minutes, not too bad. It was good but not good enough where I'd travel to have it again. The cheese mousse is creamy and fluffy, you can definitely taste the cheese as soon you reach the center of the tart. The texture of the crust is on the crispy side, like a shortbread cookie. I picked up a dozen for $42 + tax (definitely on the pricier side). If you're in the area, stop by for your first bake cheese tart bite but don't have high expectations.
author: Linda P.

description: 4 stars for the seasonal strawberry cheese tart. Really yummy. The regular ones are just ok but I would only come again for the seasonal ones. Overhyped? Yes. I wouldn't wait in a long line for these.
author: Piper W.

description: The cheese tart is pretty good here.  The perfect golden appearance together with charming smell.  It melts once you take the first bite, sweet and soft in inside with crispy layer outside.  Anyway, i felt so good after eating three a row.
author: Zhifan S.

description:
I am not a cheese tart fan, and those little cheese tart are way overpriced. It is kinda sophisticated pastry, definitely fancy but I think there is a lack of flavor in those (even with cocoa powder on top of it).
Don't be fooled, it is far way from a Pasteis de Nata, and I think that's why I am a bit disappointed..
author: Leo A.

description:
This cheese tart was Heavenly! The flavor on the inside tastes like these Gorgonzola Honey crackers I picked up in Tokyo. But, don't let that deter you if you're not into strong cheeses! My coworkers hate powerful cheeses, and they all loved these. The consistency of the filling is soft and fluffy, reminiscent of a meringue but with a little more density and then it seems like the tops are flambéd. The crust is crispy and buttery, but not flakey, more like a shortbread cookie. The ratio of crust to filling is perfection! 

All around amazing! 

My waistline is in dire jeopardy with Westfield being so close to where I work.
author: Roz M.

description:
At the urging and egging of coworkers I finally caved in and stood in the 15 minute line to see what's good with this place. I was disappointed.

This place is overrated at best.

At $3.50 each or $21.00 for a half-dozen, these are not cheap and actually quite overpriced for what you get. These can be easily made in countless numbers from a production line point of view.

To add insult to injury, I found the tarts rather bland with a clean palette and I could not find any manner of eating them that made them live up to the hype. Fresh off the line, nope. Frozen as suggested by their advertising, nope. With their Brazilian organic coffee, nope.

I think I'll stick to egg tarts from Chinatown instead.
author: Gary Z.

description: Still yummy, but the ones in Japan are better! The ones in Japan are light and fluffy in the middle, but these tarts are runny :(
author: Shawn K.

description: It's overrated . The cheese tart was good , but I don't think the price is worth it . It is pretty pricy for a small cheese tart . The line was long . It's ok
author: Isabelle L.

description: Horrible experience the service is very rude and think there above everyone else. We waited in line 3 times for the seasonal strawberry tarts and after they came out the oven they would not sell them to us even though we waited over a hour in line. They told us we would have to go back in line and wait 15 more mins until they cooled off. Literally 2 mins after walking out of line I see the lady walk over grab the tray and place it in the window and sell the couple behind me the strawberry tarts. I was pissed and walked back and asked her what was up. She simply said I don't make the rules and it's first come first serve. F this place will never go back!
author: Chris C.

description:
I ordered half a dozen after waiting for over an  hour! Got home there were only FIVE!!!!!!

The taste is good but what in the world!
author: Vivi C.

description: The tart is like cookie, the cheese is floating but a little bit heavy. Anyway, nothing surprise me. The long line is not worthy
author: Mengrou L.

description: I've been coming to pick up 6+ whenever I passed by the mall to share with friends and family.  Yesterday was the day that they rolled out of new green tea flavor.  I thought of getting new flavor for my dad's birthday.  I am very disappointed with their quality control.  With max 6 of green tea one can purchase, rather than putting aside a tray that was ugly baked, and despite that I told them it would be a gift, they insisted to sell all in that ugly tray for people in line, with a "take it or leave it" attitude.  With the price they are charging, I won't be back for a very long time.
author: Grace C.

description:
Loved it here! We made a video of our experience in case you're interested: https://youtu.be/S2k5OmZav_I

The cheese tart was soft and creamy. It was a little bit on the expensive side, but definitely worth it because it was delicious. If you're planning to go make time to stay in line, because it took us about 15 mins just to get to the register.
author: Brian C.

description: I've tried Pablo in Japan and I thought it was okay. And then I tried this place and I thought it was just okay. It is too filling for my taste, too much cheese or mouse with just regular crust on the bottom. Not worth it .
author: Melanie N.

description: I got 6 original tarts for $20. Since they made it sound like I got a big deal by getting 6 for $20 instead of $21, I decided to get 6. They were out of the strawberry and chocolate when I got there. It was a Wednesday early afternoon. I would suggest going early when the mall opens to try all the flavors. I love how the cheese tart tastes when it's fresh. Price? Not so much. I'm going to buy this one time and one time only.
author: Jeanne C.

description: Finally got a chance to go here today after months of drooling over advertisements and I was pleasantly surprised! I came around 5 pm on a weekday and the wait was only ~5 mins. The tarts are both beautiful and tasty. The crust offers a crispy contrast to the soft sweet n salty cream cheese. We ate them right after purchasing and they were still warm and fresh from baking  Only downside is the price ($3.50 for one tart, $20 for six), but the tarts are so deliciously rich that I was satisfied after just one! Definitely recommend trying, will be back for the chocolate flavor.
author: Harim L.

description: They are selling cold Tart to customers, the stuff told me I need go home and warm them by myself!! Excuse me?? The cheese tart tastes bad when it is not warm. Bad food quarry and bad service. Very disappointed.
author: terranx x.

description:
My experience at Bake cheese tart may not the typical experience of many other reviewers. I have been dying to try this place since I heard about it a few months ago but its downtown location deterred me from going. I was just not in the mood to pay expensive downtown parking or be in crowds. It just so happens that I HAD to be in downtown for something. Since I was in the area, I figured I might as well as go to Bake. It was a Thursday afternoon and there was no one in line! I lucked out... I have friends who waited for over an hour for these cheese tarts. I got a 6 pack of the original flavor. At $3.50 a pop, it was definitely pricey. It's basically the price of a cupcake. I had the cheese tarts at room temp. They were not too sweet, light, fluffy and decently cheesy. According to the card that came with the box, there are several ways to enjoy these. Hot, room temp, and frozen. Each temperature would give you a different texture. I like the different options to enjoy. So far I have only had this at room temperature. I would imagine the frozen cheese tart would taste like cheese cake.

Final verdict: It was good but not amazing. It's not worth the hour wait. But if you are able get these without the line then they are a nice treat.   3.5 stars.
author: Sunny L.

description: I love trying new places, especially the ones with a lot of hype. I saw a news piece for this lines-down-the-block place and had to try. I was there on a Thurs at 1pm.... surprisingly, no line! I bought 6 for home. The packing was very cute, each tart was separated from each other. The taste.... heavenly creamy but not heavy light a reg cheesecake, delightful cookie like crust. Downside, at $3.50 ea, too small for desert but great for a snack bite!
author: Helen D.

description: This place lives up to the hype, I'm yet to try the chocolate flavor tarts but, man this baked cheese tarts are outta this world!! I'm so glad this place expanded all the way out here to the states. Trust me the wait is worth it is go on and try them :)
author: Enjoy S.

description: Totally worth the hype. These little cheese tarts are absolutely delicious and can be enjoyed several ways chilled, baked, room temperature all with slightly different texture and taste all fantastic!
author: Ali R.

description: I waited 30 minutes the first week it opened, which isn't bad considering people waited 2 hours for this. Crazy!!! You can only buy 12 max. I got 5 cheese and 1 chocolate. The cheese tart is good, especially if you like cream cheese. The chocolate was just ok to me, but I wouldn't wait for more than 10 minutes, 15 minute max.
author: Karen H.

description: It is an "overall" good for me. There was no "wow" for me after the 1st bite, but also no disappointment either.  The tart is good warm or chill. The filling is a bit more dense after chill, very gooey when its warm. The regular tart has this salty and sweet taste in the filling. I tried strawberry fav as well, not a big deal for me. It had a little bit of tangy in the filling, if you don't ask them, I don't think you can detect that is stawberry. For me, this is hype over taste, $3.50 per tart is a bit pricey. And I understood its at a pricey location. Is it so incredible that I would like to have it all the time? Nope. If I ever happened to be near by and I haven't had it in a while, I might concider to get one. Definitely not craving for it.
author: Edy C.

description: I love the little packaging of this gem. A little pricey for the egg tart but I love how it's served warm. Wish I gotta try the chocolate one. The toppings on the side are cool and I loved putting on the Carmel. The crust is so good and I love the the topping is a consistency of a marshmallow. Plus they take card
author: Diane S.

description:
Very disappointed as it is a huge difference from the quality when I had it in Japan. Tried the original. Also, I tried the strawberry which I cannot compare as didn't have that when I was in Japan but it tasted like strawberry flavoring... And not like real fruit

Also, I asked if I can get a warm tart since I was going to eat it right away but was told that they only serve room temperature. However, they do serve it fresh in Japan so maybe that also contributed to the taste.
author: Linda H.

description:
A colleague of mine recommended this place since she knew I like to try new things. I happened to be staying in the city for work and decided to make a trip to the mall and get some things. I went with my sister and saw there was a good amount of people waiting in line at this place. We walked over to check it out .... $3.50 for a tiny little thing. We walked around for a little bit thinking what is so special about this dessert. Then I finally convinced myself to spend that $3.50 cause maybe it's really that good. As we were waiting in line, the customer ahead of us asked the staff " whats so special about this?" Then the employee says " its the first one in the US"..... so what? That doesn't explain why its special & definitely doesn't explain why it's worth that much money. First of all, if they used a smaller bag, that will save them a lot of money especially when the size of the tart is half of my palm while the bag can fit 3-4 chinese take out boxes. Anyways, this tiny tart tasted like warmed extra creamy cheesecake. It wasn't bad BUT it's not something I would  go out of my way to get.  

Bottom line, I don't know if it's worth the $3.80 ( tax included) . Being the first one in the US doesn't make it that special to me... it's all about the taste. I think I am better off spending $3-$5 on 2-3 really delicious Egg Custards.
author: Reginne B.

description: Their cheese tarts are good - similar to the ones I've had in Japan, but overpriced and not worth the 45 minute wait. Their line wraps around the store and goes out the door, while they have one cash register/cashier and one person boxing the tarts per order. They really need to work on their efficiency.
author: Regina D.

description: I ask for a fresh one out the oven and they deny to sell me fresh ones.. took my money elsewhere
author: Koko B.

description: Came here on a weekday and the store is located inside a Westfield mall basement level.  The cheese tarts taste exactly like the ones I've had in Tokyo. For $3.50 a piece, it's definitely worth it. Even after freezing the tarts and reheating they still tasted very good.
author: Ruby G.

description: Insane. Must try, heavenly little tart. Crust is unreal. I now understand the long lines.
author: Christi S.

description: Delicious cheese tarts happy to have these in SF. I do think the staff could do a slightly better job keeping the tarts in tip top shape :/ not quite as perfect as what you would get in japan, but over all they taste the same and that's what's most important. As long as BAKE stays around, I'm not going to complain.
author: Janice S.

description: That taste is totally Not worth the wait at all!!! you can give it a try when there is no line! I just got it from my frd
author: Ivan Z.

description: It's a decent cheese tart but not for the price and definitely not comparable to the one I had in Japan,
author: Aniko N.

description: If I were to vegetate in bed all day I would  eat this baby all day. Calories?!? What's that? I recommend popping these tarts in the toaster oven for about 7 min at 350 degrees. The crust will gain back that crispiness and gooey cheese.
author: Christine K.

description: great stuff. had to go back in the am to bring some back to the oc. great staff too. everyone is super nice. i was lucky both times going. there wasn't much a line. fantastic experience. would i go back just for it? eh, i found another place in the oc.. supposedly better but i've yet to try. i prolly will go back here next time i am in sf.
author: Anna L.

description:
I first had these when I was in Shinjuku, Tokyo and also had Pablo Cheese Tarts in Osaka. I'm so glad they opened this in SF because they taste just like the ones in Japan! The crust tastes like a crisp cookie and the filling was a rich creamy cheesecake/eggy filling. The only drawback is the price at $3.50 per tart, so it's a bit expensive for what it is, but it was pretty much the same price in Japan as well.

I had both the original flavor and the strawberry one and I say just stick to the original.
author: Michael L.

description:
Went on a Saturday afternoon, but wait was shorter now, as it took only about 15 mins. It was delicious! I'd definitely wait in line again. 

It had a light crunch to the shell with a smooth, delicate cheesecake like filling. I had it fresh and then reheated (in a toaster oven) so I can't speak to the chilled texture.
author: Jen S.

description: Rude manager/employee who doesn't know how to treat customers or maintain a wait for their items
author: Anika N.

description: Super yummy cheese tarts. The crust is great and the filling is so light and creamy, not too rich either! I just wish it wasn't so pricey...$3.50 is a bit much for one tiny tart.
author: Nicole T.

description: Not bad, just very expensive. The filling was flavorful, but the texture was a bit too liquidy for me.
author: Kelli-Jean C.

description: Salty, over baked tart. Tried you once, tried you twice... and Im done. It's fluffy but wasn't my tart... just going to stick to egg tarts... tasty & cheap
author: Ann L.

description: This place isn't anything special. They sell over priced cheese tarts. The only reason the line is long is because the employees are extremely slow and there is only one checkout register. If they add a second register there would hardly be a line. I guess they know only one register will be needed once the hype is gone.
author: Scott T.

description: My coworker bought them for me to try since I am new to SF and we work at the westfield centre. They are delicious and even better colddddd!!!!! They are soft and fluffy and ugh just delicious! Must try
author: Zolzaya G.

description:
i was in the line for 40min the Thursday evening.
i'm in the line again now its been for 20min...
maybe abit faster than my first time visit.
i knew that they 'r born and use high qality milk and directly from Hokkaid,imported and understood takes cost.
anyway i'm from Tokyo and ok the line its nomal if super yummy shop. hope i can get limited chocolate tart(with dandelion choco)today!
its 1:30pm Sunday afternoon now...

chocolate was sold out again by 2pm !SAD (T . T)
author: Tokibox 6.

description: Creamy cheese tart. The cream cheese inside of the tart had a bit of tartness at the finish. The crust was crunchy with right amount of sweetness to it. They were small enough so you won't feel guilty indulging it. Highly recommend.
author: Lisa N.

description: I had to try these cheese tarts to see what the hype is all about. The first Bake cheese tart in America? The line is always ridiculously deep so when I saw less than 10 people, I jumped in. They are good, but way too overpriced!! Its worth a try though.
author: Samantha D.

description: Big fan of cheese tarts and fell in love with these bad boys!! The crust is baked twice to perfection and the cheese is so soft and light. Haven't yet tried the others but I definitely enjoyed the originals.
author: Nara F.

description: Love the cheese Tart and the Brazilian  coffee. I love the cream cheese filling mixed in with custards and how crunchy and fresh the it taste. I would go there again.
author: C N.

description: I was excited to try the first US shop for this Japanese-based chain.  We arrived 10 minutes after they opened and the line still took 45 minutes.  The line was not that long, but the staff are not the most efficient.  Two employees assisted each customer while a number of other employees handled the baking/restocking.  The two young ladies did not have an efficient system going, as one stared at the rest of us while her partner was ringing a customer up.  Why didn't she begin taking another order instead of staring into space? I feel like the line could have moved much more quickly, as it should not take that long to take an order, put tarts in a box and swipe a credit card.  The second employee could begin taking the next person's order as the first employee is finishing processing payment for another customer.  There needs to be better training.  As for the cheese tarts- they are like little pillows of cheesecake clouds nestled in a crispy cookie tart crust.  Both flavors (original and chocolate) are delicious.  They are light and don't make you feel like you just are a ton of sugar and butter afterwards.  I get why these are so popular.
author: Bonnie C.

description: I loved trying this! A bit of a wait and the prices are a bit high but overall, pretty good! I would recommend this to anyone visiting downtown San Francisco looking for something new and delicious to try!
author: Junkox C.

description: Thanks for running out an hour before you are supposed to close when you could have baked more and earned more money. You suck bye
author: Emily L.

description: Came here on a Monday night around 8pm debating if I should bust out the $3.50 I could use on a viet sandwich for a single cheese tart that would be consumed in a couple bites. The line was super short, only around 4 people in front of so I figured I should try them so I could move on with my life instead of wondering what I'm missing out on. Tarts were served cold/room temperature, they were yummy, crispy crust, not too sweet and a fluffy, moussey, cheesy filling. But at $3.50 a pop, I don't know if these tarts can justify themselves.
author: Jennifer C.

description: It's delicious but somehow compares to the ones in Asia (Hong Kong, Tokyo and Osaka), its probably only half as gd. My best cheese tart experience is the Yokohama cheese tart on your way to the noodle museum; a desert to die for. The place here has reasonable short lines, but the tarts are not warm enough and the matcha tastes a little too bitter.
author: T G.

description: It's grand opening today! These cheese tarts are heavenly delicious, and the SF store will be offering a chocolate flavor using chocolates from Dandelion for a limited time only for the SF location.
author: Kally C.

description: Way overhyped!Not worth it for $3.50 a piece bite size cream cheese.Nothing special.So disappointed.I guess this place is a trap.I am not cheap but why so expensive  for an ordinary cream cheese tart? I don't get it.I'd rather have cheese cake from Cheesecake Factory than this one. I think they intentionally understaff so people would get in line and the longer the line,the more people  will get curious and I was one of those who had fallen  prey to this business.
author: Garry E.

description: I was lucky enough to catch this place within an hour of opening when nobody was in line. Their classic tart was so good!!! Everything's already baked so you're not necessarily waiting on the tarts to be made. The cashiers were also super nice and gave tons of napkins!! Overall I'd come back again if there weren't a line. Maybe they'd speed things up if they added a register or two?
author: Calvin H.

description:
Not as good as Japan. Extremely guilty hyping these to melanie and she waited 3 hours in line when she could have baked better ones. 

Sorry Mel :(
author: S S.

description: I stood in line, approx 12 mins., got this fad out my system, and now I remain baffled: Why would anyone pay close to $8 for two tiny (stress on tiny) cheese tarts? They are delicious, no doubt, but not worth the price.  It will be interesting to see if this place lasts beyond the fad.
author: Randy M.

description: Poor customer service.  Having been here once before to find the tarts just ok, I decided to stop by again as I was in the mall. I had several full bags and therefore asked if I could have a box and bag for the two tarts I wanted to purchase.  I was told no, that they are only for orders of six.  Fine, I understand.... however, I asked if I could pay for the box and bag, as I literally had nowhere to put the tarts and was planning to take them to share with my husband an hour later.  I was again gruffly told no, so I forewent the tarts without hesitation. A customer offering to pay you extra for accommodation??? Maybe you should allow that???
author: Caitlin P.

description: Definitely worth a try. I've came here on several occasions and they were busy each time. The wait isn't that long despite how long it looks but I definitely prefer going on less busier days to avoid a wait. Anyhow, it is on the pricier side, ($3.50 a pop) and although I do think that it's worth a try, I often times become indecisive when it comes to the price. I'm not even a huge fan of cheesecake but these cheese tarts are still pretty good. The inside of it is delicious and so is the crust. The crust looks like it's on the harder side but it's actually pretty good. I'm still waiting on the strawberry flavor!!!
author: Cee H.

description: I first tried this in Taipei, and it was DELICIOUS. The tarts at this new SF location suck. The cheese is barely baked and is super liquid-y and raw -- I even asked them to give me the toasty-looking ones. Seems like they take them out of the oven too early. I definitely won't come back until they're up to par with the ones I had in Taiwan.
author: Vicky C.

description: Went on a Sunday and waited in line for about 10 minutes. I would not have waited in line for an hour like some people did. They are good but not worth waiting that long lol. They only had the regular cheesecake flavor available. The chocolate had sold out earlier. It is pricey, about $3.50 for one or $21 for 6. The crust is crispy and the filling is soft and creamy like a custard. I would come back again when they have other flavors available.
author: Aimee E.

description: Very nice, but the line up is too long, about half hour wait.  All the other favour wasn't available at the time I order, only the original
author: Kirby L.

description:
I read about this place a while back, but I forgot about it. Till I went downtown shopping, went to get a bite to eat, and saw the line.... oh yeah, I have to try these tarts! 
I got hooked, and went every week now. The line is not so bad during the week, only a few people ahead of me. 
I love the airy fluffy taste, and the crust is crunchy. I like looking at the employees baking the cheese tarts. They are all puffy when they just came out of the oven! So cute! 
I like Japanese sweets, they are not as sweet as the ones here. They are a bit pricey, but they are well worth and less expensive than a plane ticket to Japan!
author: lovetoeat a.

description:
Arrived on Monday around 3:30 pm and the line wasn't long like I was expected! Waited 10-15 mins. 

Price: $3.50 for 1 
Quite pricy imo. (-1 star) 
Would not come back unless I'm taking my family from out of the state on a tour guide.
Do see myself ordering it in Japan for a cheaper price! 

Service was quick and friendly. Some workers don't smile. LOL. 

If the line is long, I recommend coming when it's not or when the hype dies down! Not worth waiting more than 15 mins for!
author: Michelle E.

description: This place has a long  line. and has one cashier and the lady whos packing the cheese tart so slow and looks like she hates her job. barely smile. they should hire people like Chipotle people are fast at least! i dont know why people waiting in line for 30mns  when theres nothing really special about the tart! i bought 8pcs and its $30 something and they dont even give you mall discount. anyways i dont think its worth of waiting in line for 30mns for this tart.
author: Lara J.

description: My sissy & friend each picked up a half dozen (less than 16-minute wait @ 11am) today before we met up for a birthday brunch - we had a few for dessert after our lunch and these original cheese tarts did not disappoint  - light & fluffy and not too sweet, with a deliciously crunchy cookie crust - must get myself some next time
author: Mia C.

description:
I remember seeing this place in Hong Kong with lines that stretched almost a whole city block in an underground mall! I was excited to give this place a tray in their new location! I got there around 2:30p on a Monday afternoon, and waited no longer than 10 minutes to get the goods. The flavor of the tart was excellent...I especially enjoyed the crunchy, buttery crust which was extremely delightful. 

However, the tart filling was really running and watery though, and unfortunately, not even warm. I got 4 tarts, but only 2 had the signature caramelization or browning of the top. I went back home and put them in the oven for 10 more minutes and then it looked perfect. The size was also a little smaller than expected. I think they need to box much faster to make sure the tarts get out warm. I was a little torn to dock one star off, but if they are charging top dollar for these tarts, I expect a much higher standard. They are still pretty new, so hopefully they find their rhythm and improve over time. I will be back though to satisfy that cheese tart craving!
author: V C.

description: I swear the workers here do not understand the word lighter. Before letting them know how many cheese tart I wanted I ask for the lighter colored cheese tart, I was thinking about reheating them at home I didn't wanted to burn them in the process. Wished they would have just said we have to pick from the tray in front of us, I would understand and wouldn't have brought a dozen an only order what I would have eaten there. Taste wasn't all there but that may have been my frustration.
author: Stephen F.

description: So good! The crunchy rich cookie combined with the fluffy sweet cheese cake is so good!! Love this place and I am a major cheesecake snob. LOL . Can't wait to come back again for a seasonal flavor . They ran out of strawberry when I came. Why can't they just make more !!!!???
author: Miss Y.

description: First the line was too long. The was price was too pricey. The chocolate was a little rough when I got it. The original tart was okay
author: CM A.

description:
Absolutely the best cheese tart ever!!!
So glad that we finally have them in San Francisco too
Worth every $$$$
author: Jane L.

description: First time been here, after over 40 mins I got the order, I order their one box classic one and one box their special one. Since i personally really like cheese, after I try it taste supper supper yummy. If you guys want try this spot, please get ready for wait, cause they only have 5 ppl in front of the store to work. Highly recommend!!!!
author: Yueming G.

description: Pass by a few times with super long lines didn't get what all the hype was about . I would say to avoid lines don't go on weekends or when there's an convention in town line is super long . Go on a regular week day the lines are shorter . Decided to try the cheese tart . It was ok didn't get why all the hype . It's just a bake cheese tart , would rather have an egg tart instead.
author: Hannah M.

description: Very expensive cheese tarts...they're not worth the money nor the wait in line, in my humble opinion. I take the BART home from the Powell station and walk past this shop everyday and the line seems to be getting smaller and smaller by the day. Hope they can maintain themselves.
author: Danny B.

description: One star based on their management. I've been in line literally 3 hours+ their management suck! Only two cashiers available while there was 200+ people  waiting in line. They work super SLOW like 10mins per one customer this is ridiculous! I kept seeing people who wasn't in line keep coming up in front and just ask for free tote bag or the gift cards without the ticket! (which they give out to first 50people who came at 10am) and the guy just gave it to them like that easy.. he even say to them I'm not supposed to give it to you guys because its for people who've been waiting in line.. but yeah he just gave it out like that. So if you want gift cards or free tote bag just stand in the front and pressure them they will eventually give everything to you don't bother stand in line. RIDICULOUS..like really!?!?
author: Shayada L.

description: Hi. I'm a huge fan of your cheese tarts. I was extremely exited when I heard you had opened here in sf. I'm from San Jose but your cheese tarts are absolutely worth the drive. I came here last week and bought three boxes for friends and family. They all fell in love. I loved them so much that I came back today to purchase 3 more boxes! Although these tarts are amazing, I am really saddened by the poor customer service provided by your employees. Both times during my visit, the female employee had a bad attitude. She did not greet me or smile. She looked so unhappy the whole duration of my visit. She even gave me the meanest look when I asked for a receipt. Both visits were around 7-8:30 pm. I'm sure that my friend and I are not the only ones that have encountered this. I've looked through some of the yelp reviews and there are several customers complaining about the bad attitude and poor customer service. I hope that you'll read this and forward it to your management team. I refuse to support an establishment that does not make me feel welcomed or respected. Thank you so much for your time.
author: Kate W.

description: If you arrive before it opens, don't expect to be served for another 25-30minutes.  Workers do not have any of these tarts ready when they open their store.  Guess the owner doesn't care to have their employees arrive a little earlier to heat up the oven to Bake these tarts.  Our Cheese and Chocolate cheese tart we're not warm.  The flavor itself me tasted good but it would probably taste a lot better heated up then room temperature.  In my opinion, this doesn't have the quality like Pablo in Tokyo, plus Pablo is cheaper.  Owner is Probably passing the shipping charges on to the customers, thus the higher cost for these tarts.  Too much hype.
author: Jasper B.

description: SOOOOOOO not worth the wait or the price. $3.50 a pop is waaayyy too high. The only saving grace of this tart is the tart part because it's actually crispy and not too thick since the texture is dense. The cheese cream can totally be enhanced with a fuller cheese flavor and feels like you're being cheated out of your money because it tastes like goldfish cheese or handi-snacks or some other artificial cheese flavoring. The cheese cream is also way too drippy. I've had a version of this in Malaysia from another Japanese brand and the cheese part was actually more custardy and had a major punch of flavor. Save your time and money, don't be fulled by the line!
author: G H.

description: The wait is super long. I can't complain about the cheese tart other than the store only have two flavors-chocolate and plain.
author: Jason C.

description: The line was about 1 hr wait on the grand opening week. Taste of the tarts are just medicore.
author: Ruthie C.

description: The cheese tart are really good although there is always a long line that is about 30-45 min wait! They should have 2 cashier instead of only one which I think the reason for the long wait & two employees to box the tarts
author: Tirso D.

description: Very inefficient workflow. Takes about 1.5-3 mins per customer.  They wait until you order to pack and the cashier also waits for them to pack.  They could have prepack and just hand to customers instead of waiting for the order.
author: P L.

description: Too pricey, Overrated, Overhyped. Yes, the slowest production line ever! Ridiculous!
author: Mich G.

description: Tarts were tasty for sure . Bummed that they seem to run out of the chocolate ones pretty fast. Haven't tried that one yet. $ 3.50 for one seems like a lot but that's the cost these days I guess .
author: alex p.

description: I thought it was so good when I saw a long line. There was a sign for strawberry and original cheese tarts. I asked for the strawberry tarts but they said sold out and would have them at certain time. So I got the original for $3.50/piece. It was disappointing for me because it was expensive, small, cold, and overly sweet for me. I really wanted to try the strawberry and thought it would taste better so I came back for the second time another day. I saw them taking it out of the oven and I thought I could order them warm. They wouldn't sell it to me warm and told to come back a hour later after it cooled. I don't understand why they order so little of other flavors if there is a demand. If you  can order so many of the original tarts, why can you order more of the other flavors. Instead, they made it difficult for customers to buy the other flavors and created this hype. For the price and the taste, trying once it is ok but It is not worth it to come back frequently to get it as dessert.
author: Anonymous B.

description: And why are these good!!!???  All hype!  Since I was downtown, I decided to try the tarts.  The line was up to the Bart doors, 1/2 hour wait.  Not very efficient service.  One cashier and one person packing the tarts.  Other people:  1 folding boxes, 1 walking around (maybe on break), and 2 getting the tarts ready to bake,  When busy, one of these people could help pack the tarts so the line moves faster.  The tarts aren't made there.  I saw cardboard trays of tarts come out, they brush something on top, put them on cookie trays and bake.  Why do you need 2 people doing this when you only bake 3 trays at a time!!!  The person behind me said eat them fresh, while they are fluffy!!  Got them home and cut one original in half.  The filling oozed out a bit where's the fluffy!!  I texted a friend and asked how was the filling suppose to be because it was more like pudding.  She said that's it.  Again, where's the fluffy!!  Cut open a chocolate tart and it was more firm.  I think the original was not baked long enough!!  My hubby says the filling tastes like the filling in a cheese danish!!!   Not worth the price!!  If you still want to try it... wait until the hype dies down!!
author: M. K.
